tweets.html:
Super cool that the stroke rehab facility Brad Paisley & LL Cool J are in has music class: https://t.co/qrLwHAwS5E

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) April 8, 2013

The song #accidentalracist is what happens when Black culture gets commodified. you can now buy our support of casual racism for a low fee.

— Sister Outsider (@FeministGriote) April 8, 2013

Oh my god FINALLY white people have an anthem

— christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) April 8, 2013

tweets.author_name: The Ghost of Eric D. Snider Past
tweets.html:
Wait, Brad Paisley's defense for wearing a Confederate flag is that he's a Lynyrd Skynyrd fan? How is that better? http://t.co/ZfKYFACaUN

— The Ghost of Eric D. Snider Past (@EricDSnider) April 8, 2013

“You want a hit, give me an hour plus a Confederate flag.” —2013 LL Cool J, basically

— Mαtt Thomαs (@mattthomas) April 8, 2013

I guess I just prefer "The Purpose Driven Racist."

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) April 8, 2013

Somewhere, right now, a rival record company executive is yelling "DESTROY ALL COPIES OF 'WHOOPS I SAID A SLUR' IMMEDIATELY" into his phone.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) April 8, 2013

My favorite part is when Brad Paisley calls hundreds of years of slavery "a can of worms."

— Christine Nangle (@nanglish) April 8, 2013

Did Brad Paisley make LL Cool J move to the back of that song?

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) April 8, 2013

Wait, people are surprised LL Cool J and Brad Paisley teamed up to do something stupid?

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) April 8, 2013

Any chance we can get Brad Paisley and LL Cool J to whip up a version of One Shining Moment for tonight because that'd be awesome.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) April 8, 2013

"Don't Judge My Doo Rag," this fall on Bravo. Watch What Happens!

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) April 8, 2013

I feel sorry for the guy in line behind Paisley at that Starbucks.

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) April 8, 2013

So "Accidental Racist" is mostly notable for making "Harlem Shake" look like profound social commentary, right?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 8, 2013

If you’re white and are like “You tell ‘em Brad Paisley!” maybe read Beloved or Roots or a book.

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) April 8, 2013

I'm surprised no one made as big a deal when Ted Nugent and Matisyahu made "Accidental Jew-Hater"

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) April 8, 2013

Dear @alyankovic: "Accidental Racist" is the DEFINITION of a "Glengarry lead."

— Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) April 8, 2013

"I'll do it!" - LL Cool J answering his phone

— Peter Schultz (@pete_schultz) April 8, 2013

TV Pitch: Odd Couple re-boot. LLCool J. Brad Paisley. "Accidental Racists" Hollywood, make it so.

— Samantha Bee (@iamsambee) April 8, 2013

@iamsambee It's got CBS written all over it.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) April 8, 2013

"I like everything except rap and country" well boy do I have a song for you

— Fake Gamer Daddy (@Jonny_Wags) April 8, 2013

I'm going to choose to believe that Accidental Racist is just a song about terrible outfits.

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) April 8, 2013

"Accidental Racist" left out the second half of the title "But Still Racist."

— Betty F*ckin' White (@BettyFckinWhite) April 8, 2013

Finally listened to accidental racist. Weird that instead of a rewind option there's just a button that sets race relations back.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) April 8, 2013

Brad Paisley? More like Brad (is) PALS-Y with African-Americans & is ready to laugh off history over a few #CoorsLights!

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) April 8, 2013

Looking forward to Brad Paisley's follow up single, "Coincidental Hate Crime!"

— Daniel Van Kirk (@danielvankirk) April 9, 2013

Think I'll check in with this "Game Of Thongs" tweet I've been worki- *gets decapitated by avalanche of Brad Paisley tweets*

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) April 9, 2013

Idea: rename Accidental Racist "Trying to Be a Better Person Not That I Think Some People are Better Than Others Oh Boy I Done It Again."

— Abbi Crutchfield (@curlycomedy) April 9, 2013

Lost lyrics of Accidental Racist: Mama likes lawn jockeys/ Has 'em in her yard/ But not me; I hate that stuff / Too gaudy! Makes mowin' hard

— Abbi Crutchfield (@curlycomedy) April 9, 2013

Now that they've ended racism I hope Brad and LL sing a song about getting up in the middle of the night several times to pee. #RealProblems

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) April 9, 2013

Goddammit, won't somebody PLEASE make a song that will forgive me for all this racism I keep stumbling into? Preferably a duet.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 9, 2013

I liked Accidental Racist better when it was sung by GOB and Franklin

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) April 9, 2013

I feel like I really should listen to "Accidental Racist" instead of just knee-jerking out a joke, so--HOLY FUCK IT'S 6 MINUTES LONG?

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 9, 2013

"Accidentally Racist" is joke proof. There's nothing you can say that's funnier than the lyrics. Sit back and enjoy this one.

— Dave Horwitz (@Dave_Horwitz) April 9, 2013

Also not looking forward to Brad Paisley's follow-up single, "Separate But Equal."

— Aaron Fullerton (@AaronFullerton) April 9, 2013

Can't wait for Brad Paisley's new song "Cool With Black People, Not So Sure About Gays".

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) April 9, 2013

Is it racist if I want all country musicians removed from the human race?

— Louis Virtel (@louisvirtel) April 9, 2013

bro i just read the lyrics to accidental racists cause im not gonna listen and, my dude, these are GROWN MULTI-MILLIONAIRE RECORDING ARTISTS

— steel tipped dove (@steeltippeddove) April 9, 2013

I don't need to listen to "Accidental Racist." I saw Crash.

— Adam Weinstein (@AdamWeinstein) April 9, 2013

I can't believe people are mourning the death of a lady who tried to ban that little boy from ballet school.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) April 8, 2013

But what do the Oak Ridge Boys think of Accidental Racist is the real question here.

Let's all enjoy these last few months before Michael B. Jordan becomes a huge star. Right now he's still our little secret.

A show on History Channel about killing deer is engineered specifically to troll Chuck Grassley, and you cannot convince me otherwise.

If the Teen Mom's sex tape features condoms, at least it might teach the MTV Generation about irony.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 8, 2013

How about using Kickstarter for the next season of Dr Who? Then everyone will work together and get exactly the show they want!

— Stephen Gallagher (@brooligan) April 8, 2013

When you discover #Spartacus long after its finale, and wonder why no one ever told you how great it is…well, don’t look at me.

#nextweekonMadMen "Who?" "What?" "When?" "Where?" "Why?" "How?" Only on AMC. #madmen

Actual comment: "Get back to what makes Mad Men Great and stop the introspection." Wait, what?

these mad men really think windows are fascinating

Currently obsessed with the possibility that Liz Lemon is Peggy Olson's lovechild. Did you see how excited she was about that meatball sub?

Just realized James Wolk plays characters named "Bob" on both #LoneStar & #MadMen. Bob and Don have a LOT to talk about.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 8, 2013

Petition to turn #MadMen into a remake of IN TREATMENT where Roger sees a different therapist every day of the week.

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) April 9, 2013

With the talk about what Fox wants to do, NBC just might not be the first of the big 4 networks to die.

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) April 9, 2013

If Fox becomes a cable network, maybe they'll rebrand themselves as FXXXXXXXXXX.
